titleStmt.title: Usurpation defeated, and David restored being an exact parallel between David and our most Gracious Soveraign King Charls II. In their dangerous dissettlement, and wonderfull restauration. Laid open in a sermon on II Sam. XIX. 14. Preached on the publique solemn day of thanksgiving, May 24 1660 in the Collegiate Church of Manchester in the county palatine of Lancaster. By Henry Newcome Master in Arts, and minister of the Gospel there.
titleStmt.author: Newcome, Henry, 1627-1695.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Ralph Shelmerdine book-seller in Manchester,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in Dr. Williams's Library, London.
